[tʂʊ́ŋkwɔ̌ jǒʊtʂə̂ŋ]

LayoutNode.Content: China Post is the official postal service of China. The State Post Bureau of the People's Republic of China, the owner of China Post, is both a regulatory authority and government-owned enterprise. Thus, it is responsible for the regulation of the national postal industry and the management of national postal enterprises.
LayoutNode.SRC: China Post is the official postal service of China. The State Post Bureau of the People's Republic of China, the owner of China Post, is both a regulatory authority and government-owned enterprise. Thus, it is responsible for the regulation of the national postal industry and the management of national postal enterprises.

LayoutNode.Content: Main article: Postage stamps and postal history of China
LayoutNode.SRC: Main article: Postage stamps and postal history of China

LayoutNode.Content: The postal service in China can be dated back to the Shang Dynasty.Customs Post Office of the Qing Empire was established in 1878 by Li Hongzhang at the suggestion of the foreign powers, with branch offices in five major trading cities. On 20 March 1896, the Customs Post Office became the Great Qing Post, which in 1911 became independent of the customs service. Until 1949, Chunghwa Post had functioned as the main postal service provider of Mainland China.
LayoutNode.SRC: The postal service in China can be dated back to the Shang Dynasty.Customs Post Office of the Qing Empire was established in 1878 by Li Hongzhang at the suggestion of the foreign powers, with branch offices in five major trading cities. On 20 March 1896, the Customs Post Office became the Great Qing Post, which in 1911 became independent of the customs service. Until 1949, Chunghwa Post had functioned as the main postal service provider of Mainland China.

LayoutNode.Content: The current postal service of People's Republic of China was established in 1949. It replaced the Chunghwa Post in mainland China in 1949, as well as in the Universal Postal Union in 1972. It was formerly administered by the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications. China Post is directly supervised by the State Post Bureau of the PRC which has overall responsibility for regulating postal service in China. The State Post Bureau is an agency reporting to the Ministry of Information Industry of the People's Republic of China.
LayoutNode.SRC: The current postal service of People's Republic of China was established in 1949. It replaced the Chunghwa Post in mainland China in 1949, as well as in the Universal Postal Union in 1972. It was formerly administered by the Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications. China Post is directly supervised by the State Post Bureau of the PRC which has overall responsibility for regulating postal service in China. The State Post Bureau is an agency reporting to the Ministry of Information Industry of the People's Republic of China.

LayoutNode.Content: China Post is organized along the following organizational structure.
LayoutNode.SRC: China Post is organized along the following organizational structure.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the new postal research strategies and policies, coordination, media and publicity, feedback, complaints and safety and security issues.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the new postal research strategies and policies, coordination, media and publicity, feedback, complaints and safety and security issues.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the regulation of postal market and the formulation of postal laws and regulations.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the regulation of postal market and the formulation of postal laws and regulations.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the issue of postage vouchers and philatelic services.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the issue of postage vouchers and philatelic services.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the finance, state-owned assets and the development of postal technologies.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the finance, state-owned assets and the development of postal technologies.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the construction and operation of post routes and logistic issues.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the construction and operation of post routes and logistic issues.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the management of international postal affairs and services.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the management of international postal affairs and services.

LayoutNode.Content: Responsible for the personnel, income payment and human resources education in the postal sector.
LayoutNode.SRC: Responsible for the personnel, income payment and human resources education in the postal sector.
